method.name: extractBitmap
method.comment: Returns an immutable bitmap from the specified subset of the source bitmap. The new bitmap may be the same object as source, or a copy may have been made. It is initialized with the same density as the original bitmap. source: x: y: width: height: Return type: @return:

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the RSSImageProcessing Library. EventName - Events subs prefix.

method.name: eraseColor
method.comment: Fills the bitmap's pixels with the specified Color. bitmap: the source bitmap. (must be mutable!) c: colours

method.name: createScaledBitmap
method.comment: Creates a new bitmap, scaled from an existing bitmap. src The source bitmap. dstWidth The new bitmap's desired width. dstHeight The new bitmap's desired height. filter true if the source should be filtered. Return type: @return:the bitmap

method.name: isMutable
method.comment: Returns true if the bitmap is marked as mutable (i.e. can be drawn into) bitmap: Return type: @return:

method.name: translateBitmap
method.comment: Translate the bitmap. bitmap: degrees: Return type: @return:

method.name: getPixel
method.comment: Returns the Color at the specified location. Throws an exception if x or y are out of bounds (negative or >= to the width or height respectively). bitmap: x: The x coordinate (0...width-1) of the pixel to return y: The y coordinate (0...height-1) of the pixel to return Return type: @return:The argb Color at the specified coordinate

method.name: extractBitmap2
method.comment: Returns an immutable bitmap from the specified subset of the source bitmap. The new bitmap may be the same object as source, or a copy may have been made. It is initialized with the same density as the original bitmap. source: x: y: width: height: Return type: @return:

method.name: isRecycled
method.comment: Returns true if this bitmap has been recycled. If so, then it is an error to try to access its pixels, and the bitmap will not draw. bitmap: Return type: @return:true if the bitmap has been recycled

method.name: compress
method.comment:
Write a compressed version of the bitmap to the specified outputstream.
format The format of the compressed image quality Hint to the compressor, 0-100. 0 meaning compress for small size, 100 meaning compress for max quality. Some formats, like PNG which is lossless, will ignore the quality setting stream The outputstream to write the compressed data.

method.name: writeBitmapToFile
method.comment: Writes a bitmap to a file

method.name: recycle
method.comment: Free the native object associated with this bitmap, and clear the reference to the pixel data. This will not free the pixel data synchronously; it simply allows it to be garbage collected if there are no other references. The bitmap is marked as "dead", meaning it will throw an exception if getPixels() or setPixels() is called, and will draw nothing. This operation cannot be reversed, so it should only be called if you are sure there are no further uses for the bitmap. This is an advanced call, and normally need not be called, since the normal GC process will free up this memory when there are no more references to this bitmap. bitmap:

method.name: rotateBitmap
method.comment: Rotates the bitmap. bitmap: degrees: Return type: @return:

method.name: extractAlpha
method.comment: Returns a new bitmap that captures the alpha values of the original. bitmap:

method.name: getDestination
method.comment: Gets the new destination width or height keeping the aspect ratio of the image. src: - bitmap destination: -Source width or height Return type: @return:

method.name: hasAlpha
method.comment: Returns true if the bitmap's config supports per-pixel alpha, and if the pixels may contain non-opaque alpha values. For some configs, this is always false (e.g. RGB_565), since they do not support per-pixel alpha. However, for configs that do, the bitmap may be flagged to be known that all of its pixels are opaque. In this case hasAlpha() will also return false. If a config such as ARGB_8888 is not so flagged, it will return true by default. bitmap: Return type: @return:

method.name: skewBitmap
method.comment: Skews the bitmap. bitmap: kx: ky: Return type: @return:

method.name: scaleBitmap
method.comment: Scales the bitmap. bitmap: degrees: Return type: @return:

method.name: SaturationFilter
method.comment:
Filters the saturation of a bitmap. By converting RGB to HSV, we can adjust pixel color in different way.

method.name: Wedding
method.comment: Wedding src: Factor: 16 Offset: 0 Return type: @return:Filter

method.name: GaussianFilter2
method.comment: Gaussian filter.

method.name: MeanRemoval
method.comment:
Mean Removal Effect makes uses of Convolution Matrix. The applied matrix is: [ -1 | -1 | -1 ] [ -1 | 9 | -1 ] [ -1 | -1 | -1 ]
Filter

method.name: HueFilter
method.comment:
Filters the Hue of a bitmap. By converting RGB to HSV, we can adjust pixel color in different way.
Filter

method.name: BlackFilter
method.comment:
Base on randomizing image pixels, another filter is created, named “Black Filter“, or enhance the noise of darkness. The algorithm is to generate a threshold number (0-255), if all R,G,B values of a pixel are less than the threshold, then set the pixel to black.
Filter

method.name: ColorFilter
method.comment:
Filter the color on the bitmap, in which to display image by only one channel or combine the increase on every channel.
Filter

method.name: EdgeEnhancement3
method.comment: Edge Enhancement

method.name: EdgeEnhancement2
method.comment: Edge Enhancement

method.name: ShadingFilter
method.comment:
Shading Filter is a technique that use AND operator for the current pixel color and a desired-shading color.
Filter

method.name: GaussianFilter
method.comment: Gaussian filter.

method.name: FindEdge
method.comment: Find Edge

method.name: EdgeEnhancement
method.comment: Edge Enhancement

method.name: ColorBoost
method.comment:
Color boost technique is basically based on color filtering, which is to increase the intensity of a single color channel.
Effect

method.name: GreyScale
method.comment:
Greyscales a bitmap The intensity is calculated by common formula: 30% of Red + 59% of Green + 11 % of Blue
Effects

method.name: Paintify
method.comment:
Makes a paint like effect on a picture. 128 (or 64/32) 8 1
Effect

method.name: Sharpen2
method.comment:
Sharpening effect make uses of Convolution Matrix The applied matrix is: [ 0 | -2 | 0 ] [ -2 | 11 | -2 ] [ 0 | -2 | 0 ]
Filter Weight : 3

method.name: RoundCorner
method.comment: Create a bitmap with round corners. Effect

method.name: Paintify2
method.comment:
Makes a paint like effect on a picture. 128 (or 64/32) 8 1
Effect

method.name: Rotate
method.comment:
Rotates a bitmaps
Effects

method.name: Contrast
method.comment:
Contrast is the difference in luminance and/or colour that makes an object (or its representation in an image or display) distinguishable. In visual perception of the real world, contrast is determined by the difference in the colour and brightness of the object and other objects within the same field of view.
Effects

method.name: Highlight
method.comment:
Highlights a bitmap.
Effects

method.name: Invert
method.comment: Inverts a bitmap. Every image pixel holds information of four channels: Alpha, Red, Green, Blue. However, Alpha doesn’t reflect the image color as display. So the value is kept, and take inversion for other three channels by formula: 0xFF – CurrentValue.

method.name: Flip
method.comment:
Flips a bitmap vertically.
Effect

method.name: Blur
method.comment: Does a Gaussian Blur to the image. - Filter It uses the concepts of Convolution Filtering to apply in image processing.

method.name: Brightness
method.comment:
The concept of brightness is rather simple, increasing/decreasing value of each R, G, B channel together. + By increasing: image results brighter. + By decreasing: image results darker.
Effects

method.name: Snow
method.comment:
Adds a snow-like effect to the bitmap. Opposite of Black Filter Sets all pixels having R,G,B values to the max (0xFF) when they’re greater than threshold, then we have the Snow Effect.
Effect

method.name: Smooth
method.comment:
Smoothens a bitmap. The factor is 13 and offset 1.
Filter

method.name: Emboss
method.comment:
Embosses your bitmap to make it look sketchy like.
Filter

method.name: Mirror
method.comment:
Flips a bitmap horizontally.
Effect

method.name: ReplaceColor
method.comment:
Replaces pixels from one color to the other.
Effect

method.name: Watermark
method.comment: Gives your image a watermark, choose the location of the text, etc, etc Effect

method.name: SepiaToning
method.comment:
Sepia-toning effect is used very commonly in photography. It is the process of changing the intensity on every pixel color of a gray-scale image, or so-called black-and-white.
Effects

method.name: Sharpen
method.comment:
Sharpening effect make uses of Convolution Matrix The applied matrix is: [ 0 | -2 | 0 ] [ -2 | 11 | -2 ] [ 0 | -2 | 0 ]
Filter Weight : 3

method.name: Posterize
method.comment:
Decreasing color depth involves converting to standard values. For example: if I want to offset 32, then each image color channel will apply the range: 0, 31, 63 …
Effects

method.name: TintColor
method.comment:
Gives a nice tint color to a bitmap. degree: Use the constants for the degree.
Effect

method.name: Noise
method.comment:
Gives a noise or flea effect to the bitmap
Effect

method.name: Sketchify
method.comment: Sketchify a photo. src: Factor: 16 Offset: 0 Return type: @return:Effect

method.name: Reflection
method.comment:
Makes a mirror/reflection like ReflectionGap: gap space between original and reflected
Effect

method.name: GammaCorrection
method.comment:
Gamma correction or gamma encoding is one among the common image processing method Gamma correction, gamma nonlinearity, gamma encoding, or often simply gamma, is the name of a nonlinear operation used to code and decode luminance or tristimulus values in video or still image systems.
Effect

method.name: Engrave
method.comment:
Engraves your bitmap.
Filter
